header.subheader: Golden Retrievers: English Cream and Red Coats Available
header.alt: A golden retriever puppy for sale in Sheridan MI

intro.copy: Golden Retrievers are known for their loyal, friendly, and playful temperament. At Prairie Creek Puppies, we offer both English Cream and Red Coat Golden Retrievers raised in a loving environment. Read more to learn if a Golden Retriever is right for you.

faq.title: Shedding
faq.description: Golden Retrievers shed heavily, especially during seasonal changes. Regular brushing, at least 2-3 times a week, is necessary to manage the shedding and keep their coat healthy.

faq.title: Size
faq.description: Adult Golden Retrievers typically weigh between 55-75 pounds and require a spacious living environment. Their size makes them great family dogs, but they do need ample room to play and exercise.

faq.title: Temperament
faq.description: Golden Retrievers are highly social and affectionate dogs, known for their friendly and loyal temperament. They get along well with children, adults, and other pets.

faq.title: Energy Level
faq.description: Golden Retrievers are active dogs that require regular physical activity. Daily walks and playtime are essential to keep them happy and prevent boredom.

faq.title: Trainability
faq.description: Golden Retrievers are one of the most trainable breeds due to their intelligence and eagerness to please. They excel in obedience training and are often used as service or therapy dogs.

faq.title: Health
faq.description: While Golden Retrievers are generally healthy dogs, they can be prone to genetic conditions such as hip dysplasia. Regular vet checkups and a healthy diet help manage these risks.

faq.title: Lifespan
faq.description: Golden Retrievers typically live for 10-12 years. With proper care and a balanced lifestyle, they can enjoy long, happy lives as family companions.

faq.title: Grooming
faq.description: In addition to frequent brushing, Golden Retrievers need occasional baths, nail trimming, and ear cleaning to prevent infections, especially if they love swimming.

header.alt: A mini bernedoodle puppy for sale in Sheridan MI

intro.copy: Mini Bernedoodles are a popular crossbreed known for their gentle and affectionate nature. At Prairie Creek Puppies, we raise Mini Bernedoodles in a loving environment, ensuring they are well-socialized and ready to become the perfect family companion. Read more to learn if a Mini Bernedoodle is right for you.

faq.title: Shedding
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles are known for their low to moderate shedding, depending on coat type. Regular grooming and brushing can help manage their coat and reduce shedding.

faq.title: Size
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles typically weigh between 25-50 lbs and stand around 18-22 inches tall. Their size makes them great for both apartments and larger living spaces.

faq.title: Temperament
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles are incredibly affectionate and loyal, known for forming strong bonds with their families. They are great with children and other pets.

faq.title: Energy Level
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles enjoy playtime and regular exercise. While they have bursts of energy, they are equally happy lounging around the house.

faq.title: Trainability
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles are intelligent and eager to please, making them highly trainable. Positive reinforcement techniques work best with this gentle breed.

faq.title: Health
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles are generally healthy, but they can be prone to conditions like hip dysplasia. Regular vet visits and a balanced diet help ensure their long-term well-being.

faq.title: Lifespan
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles typically live for 12-15 years. With proper care, regular exercise, and a balanced diet, they can enjoy a long and healthy life.

faq.title: Grooming
faq.description: Mini Bernedoodles require regular grooming to maintain their coat, especially if it's curly. Regular brushing, trimming, and baths will help keep them looking their best.

header.alt: A goldendoodle puppy for sale in Sheridan MI

intro.copy: Goldendoodles are a crossbreed known for their friendly nature, intelligence, and hypoallergenic coats. At Prairie Creek Puppies, we offer both Standard and Mini Goldendoodles raised with love and care. Read more to learn if a Goldendoodle is right for you.

faq.title: Shedding
faq.description: Goldendoodles typically have low to moderate shedding, depending on their coat type. Regular grooming and brushing help manage their shedding and keep their coat healthy.

faq.title: Size
faq.description: Goldendoodles come in a range of sizes, from Mini Goldendoodles (weighing 15-30 lbs) to Standard Goldendoodles (weighing 45-90 lbs). They adapt well to different living environments.

faq.title: Temperament
faq.description: Goldendoodles are known for their friendly and affectionate nature. They get along well with children, adults, and other pets, making them great family companions.

faq.title: Energy Level
faq.description: Goldendoodles are energetic and love to play. They require regular exercise, including daily walks and playtime, to keep them happy and healthy.

faq.title: Trainability
faq.description: Goldendoodles are highly intelligent and easy to train. They excel in obedience training and are often used as service or therapy dogs due to their gentle temperament.

faq.title: Health
faq.description: While Goldendoodles are generally healthy, they may be prone to conditions such as hip dysplasia or certain genetic disorders. Regular vet visits and a healthy lifestyle help manage these risks.

faq.title: Lifespan
faq.description: Goldendoodles typically live for 12-15 years. With proper care and regular exercise, they can enjoy a long and happy life as a beloved family pet.

faq.title: Grooming
faq.description: Goldendoodles require regular grooming due to their curly or wavy coats. Regular brushing, baths, and occasional trims help prevent matting and keep them looking their best.

header.alt: A Shih Tzu puppy for sale in Sheridan MI

intro.copy: Shih Tzus are affectionate, outgoing, and charming small dogs that make excellent companions. At Peaceful Country Pets, we raise AKC Shih Tzus with love and care, ensuring they are well-socialized and ready to become a part of your family. Read more to learn if a Shih Tzu is right for you.

faq.title: Shedding
faq.description: Shih Tzus have a double coat that sheds minimally. Regular grooming and brushing are essential to prevent matting and keep their coat healthy.

faq.title: Size
faq.description: Adult Shih Tzus typically weigh between 9-16 pounds and stand about 9-10.5 inches tall, making them perfect for apartment living or homes with limited space.

faq.title: Temperament
faq.description: Shih Tzus are known for their loving and friendly nature. They thrive on human companionship and get along well with children and other pets.

faq.title: Energy Level
faq.description: Shih Tzus enjoy daily walks and playtime but are also content lounging with their families. They adapt well to their owner's activity level.

faq.title: Trainability
faq.description: Shih Tzus are intelligent but can be a bit stubborn. Consistent, positive reinforcement training methods work best with this breed.

faq.title: Health
faq.description: While generally healthy, Shih Tzus can be prone to certain conditions like eye issues and respiratory problems due to their short muzzles. Regular vet check-ups are important.

faq.title: Lifespan
faq.description: Shih Tzus typically live between 10-16 years. With proper care, nutrition, and regular veterinary visits, they can enjoy a long, healthy life.

faq.title: Grooming
faq.description: Shih Tzus require regular grooming due to their long, luxurious coats. Daily brushing and regular professional grooming are recommended to keep them looking their best.

header.alt: A Mini Dachshund puppy for sale in Sheridan MI

intro.copy: Mini Dachshunds are lively, courageous, and affectionate small dogs with big personalities. At Peaceful Country Pets, we raise Mini Dachshunds with love and care, ensuring they are well-socialized and ready to become a part of your family. Read more to learn if a Mini Dachshund is right for you.

faq.title: Shedding
faq.description: Mini Dachshunds can have smooth, long-haired, or wire-haired coats. Shedding varies with coat type, but regular grooming helps manage shedding and keeps their coat healthy.

faq.title: Size
faq.description: Adult Mini Dachshunds typically weigh up to 11 pounds and stand about 5-6 inches tall, making them suitable for apartment living or homes with limited space.

faq.title: Temperament
faq.description: Mini Dachshunds are known for their bold and lively nature. They are loyal to their families and can be a bit wary of strangers, making them good watchdogs.

faq.title: Energy Level
faq.description: Mini Dachshunds have bursts of energy and enjoy daily walks and playtime. They also appreciate cuddle time with their owners.

faq.title: Trainability
faq.description: Mini Dachshunds are intelligent but can be stubborn. Consistent, positive reinforcement training methods are effective with this breed.

faq.title: Health
faq.description: Due to their long backs, Mini Dachshunds are prone to intervertebral disc disease (IVDD). Preventative care and avoiding excessive jumping can help manage risks.

faq.title: Lifespan
faq.description: Mini Dachshunds typically live between 12-16 years. With proper care, nutrition, and regular veterinary visits, they can enjoy a long, healthy life.

faq.title: Grooming
faq.description: Grooming needs vary by coat type. Smooth coats require minimal grooming, while long-haired and wire-haired Dachshunds need regular brushing to prevent matting.
